shortanswer.question: Derive sin(θ/2) using the half-angle formula.
expectedAny: start with cos(2α) = 1 - 2sinα and substitute α = θ/2 to get sin(θ/2) = [(1 - cosθ)/2]
use double angle formula in reverse

shortanswer.question: Prove the identity sinθ + cosθ = 1 using the unit circle.
expectedAny: on unit circle x + y = 1 and x = cosθ, y = sinθ so cosθ + sinθ = 1
unit circle definition gives the Pythagorean identity
coordinates on unit circle satisfy x + y = 1

shortanswer.question: Use product-to-sum to simplify 2sinθcosφ.
expectedAny: equals sum of sines using product formula

shortanswer.question: Prove tanθ = sinθ/cosθ.
expectedAny: from unit circle tanθ is y/x and sinθ/cosθ is also y/x
definitions from right triangle opposite/adjacent equals opposite/hypotenuse divided by adjacent/hypotenuse

shortanswer.question: Find sin15 exactly using half-angle formula.
expectedAny: use θ = 30 in half angle formula

shortanswer.question: Why are half-angle formulas useful?
expectedAny: find exact values for angles like 15 or 22.5 not on unit circle
compute non-standard angles from known values
evaluate trig functions at half the known angle

shortanswer.question: Prove 1 + tanθ = secθ.
expectedAny: divide sinθ + cosθ = 1 by cosθ to get tanθ + 1 = secθ
from fundamental identity dividing by cos squared
